Based on the search results, I found relevant information about the impact of "The Lord of the Rings" on education in Poland, particularly regarding its inclusion in school reading lists. Here's what I found:

## The Lord of the Rings in Polish School Education

The Ministry of National Education announced a new canon of school readings that includes significant changes to the literature curriculum. "The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring" by J.R.R. Tolkien will be available for thorough analysis in high schools and technical schools.

### Current Status in Polish Schools

"The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring" has been included on the list of supplementary readings for high schools and technical schools. It will depend on the teacher whether Tolkien's novel will be discussed in classes.

It's worth noting that another Tolkien fantasy work, "The Hobbit," has had its place in the reading canon for years. Currently, the Ministry of Education has decided that "The Hobbit" will be a mandatory reading for grades 4-6.

### Educational Challenges and Considerations

This is undoubtedly a challenge for both students and teachers, as the list of mandatory readings in secondary schools is long and Tolkien's novel itself contains over 400 pages.

There are differing opinions about the appropriateness of the work for younger students. Even Tolkien said that "The Lord of the Rings" is not suitable for children, if it's suitable for anyone at all. This suggests that "The Lord of the Rings" should be a reading for 2nd-3rd grade high school or 3rd-4th grade technical school.

Some educators believe that "The Lord of the Rings" is not appropriate for youth under 16 years of age.

### Broader Context of Reading Lists

The 2021/2022 school reading lists included significant changes, with works by Zofia Kossak-Szczucka, John Paul II, and world classics being added according to announcements by the Minister of Education and Science.

The Ministry of Education and Science proposed expanding the reading list for high schools and technical schools to include works such as "The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring" by J.R.R. Tolkien.

The inclusion of Tolkien's work represents a significant addition to Polish educational literature, introducing students to the fantasy genre alongside traditional classics, though it comes with challenges regarding age appropriateness and the substantial length of the work.
